What are some opinions on Super Hero movies? What's the best/worse comicbook superhero movie. Anything that started as a Comicbook series that made it to the bigscreen works. (Superman, Batman, X-Men, Spider-Man, Fantastic 4, ect.) emoticon_cool.
Eddie

Best comic book: X-men
 Best comic book movie: Spider Man
 
 Worst comic book: Fantastic Four
 Worst comic book movie: Electra
 
 Honorary mentions (but not a part of the actual list due to the fact that it is a graphic novel rather than comic book): Sin City
sanguinekane

Ugh, I hate super-hero movies. I dont know why, I just detest them. Well, there are a few exceptions. Batman Begins was rather good in my opinion, then there is Spawn, but I don't know if he counts as a super-hero. And the movie kind of sucked to, but the animated ones were all right.
Master_Shake

Best: Spiderman 2 and Batman Begins
 Honorable mentions: Smpiderman and Batman (The originals)
 
 
Honorary mentions (but not a part of the actual list due to the fact that it is a graphic novel rather than comic book): Sin City

 Could you please explain to me the difference? Cuz it always seemed to me that "graphic novel" was just a pretensious way of saying "comic book."
Kronus

Could you please explain to me the difference? Cuz it always seemed to me that "graphic novel" was just a pretensious way of saying "comic book."

 
 Comic books are cranked out on a tight schedule which limits the quality, and the writers and artists change all the time. Graphic novels are written/drawn by one team throughout, and much more time is allocated to their creation, so quality tends to be much higher.
Raastee

I loved Spiderman 2, great love story, great hero....
 
 I hated DareDevil.
Eddie

Could you please explain to me the difference? Cuz it always seemed to me that "graphic novel" was just a pretensious way of saying "comic book."

 
 Well I would say that the difference lies in quality. One could perhaps make an argument that graphic novels have some form of cultural quality to it, whereas comic books only have entertainment value (sort of like the difference between art and porn, theatre and "sit.coms", opera and pop music etc, etc)
Ooaman
Has anyone seen previews or anything for X-Men 3 yet? So far, I've just seen a poster but it's supposed to come out next spring (or early summer) I believe. :)
Ooaman
I was just wondering how many of you saw X-Men 3 yet and also if anyone stayed for the ending credits. There is a surprise after the credits roll.
Inyx

Now you tell us. I did, two days ago, but did not stay untill the end od the ending credits. 
 Bummer, what it was and was it any good (can you tell me plz what it was? At least through pm, if not here)?
 
 Hm, i don't read comics at all, so I cant give you an opinion on that one. I did however watch the cartoons, at least for those superheroes that they were made (Spidy, X-men, Batman, Superman). I enyoyed them more, the cartoons I mean. But the movies were good too, except for X-men, I was a bit diappointed with those.
Bell

I really enjoyed X-Men 3! My boyfriend, a comic book/graphic novel buff, said that he enjoyed it as well, even though they didn't quite get the Jean Grey storyline "correct". He said that if they had gone to all the trouble to do it accurately to the comic book it would've been a very long series of movies.
 
 We didn't stay until the end because...well, long story, but we usually do wait until the credits end. Heard about it the next day. I think that's terribly frustrating. You pay quite a bit of money (some theatres around here charge an insane $12!) and then you don't get to see the entire movie. 
 
 I am looking forward to the new Superman flick, as well as the Punisher movie and the next Spiderman. They are going to show Superman at the local IMAX in 3D! Woo!
MTKnight

Ugh, there was something at the end of the credits...:(
 
 That gets me frustrated. If anyone wants to pm me about what happened it would be appreciated. If not I'll just have to rent it I guess.
 
 Or I'll ask a around. emoticon_xgood
foundit66

I was just wondering how many of you saw X-Men 3 yet and also if anyone stayed for the ending credits. There is a surprise after the credits roll.

 My partner and I were sitting the movie theater after the movie had ended, talking about it.
 ... and talking about it...
 
 After a while, I looked up and mentioned to him that there were a LOT of people STILL in the theater, even though the credits were rolling.
 
 About a minute later, we saw "the ending" that came after the credits.
 
 So to answer your question, we saw it but only by luck...

I really enjoyed X-Men 3! My boyfriend, a comic book/graphic novel buff, said that he enjoyed it as well, even though they didn't quite get the Jean Grey storyline "correct". He said that if they had gone to all the trouble to do it accurately to the comic book it would've been a very long series of movies.
Yeah well none of the X-Men films have overly been true to the original, and the (Dark) Phoenix bit probably even less than others. But they don't totally butcher it, and do it well overall really.
 
 
some theatres around here charge an insane $12!
That's what? Under £6.50! My God I'd be lucky to see a film that cheaply in London!

 Why don't you like the Spiderman movies? IMHO they were two of the best superhero movies ever made.
 And I liked Batman Forever, although it was not as good as the first or Batman Begins and I completely agree with you on Batman and Robin. It had some of he worst dialogue I've seen in any film, not just in superhero films.
Phunting

Why don't you like the Spiderman movies? IMHO they were two of the best superhero movies ever made.
It's been a while, so I can't remember everything. But some do spring to mind (and spoilers throughout):
 
 - The 'emotional' (read: clichéd and cringe worthy) death of Parker's uncle.
 - Mary Jane being constantly screaming like a useless girlie until she's rescued by a man in the best traditions of C16th chauvinism.
 - The Green Goblin's costume
 - Parker being such a fecking goody goody all the time.
 - Octopus realizing the error of his ways and sacrificing himself at the last moment in possibly the most predictable way ever.
Ooaman

...
 - Octopus realizing the error of his ways and sacrificing himself at the last moment in possibly the most predictable way ever.

 I think with Doc. Oct, his deal wasn't that he had to realize the "error of his ways" as much as it was that he had to over come that which was over coming him. The mechanical arms had taken over his mind or at least his will. They were able to do that because he just gave up after the death of his wife and the loss of everything important to him. When Parker convinced him that he was able to be better, he decided that he could and then over powered the arms...
 
 That is unless I misunderstood the plot.
Phunting

You're quite right. But even dressed up with a slightly different hat it's still the old cliché of 'villain turns good at very end, saves goodies but dies it the attempt'.
 
 It's very nice. It allows the goodies all the moral superiority, as their ideology is proven superior, the villain is destroyed and they don't even have to deal with the moral problem of killing him...

Hey, has anyone seen Super Man Returns yet? I haven't yet but I do intend to sometime soon.

 
 I saw it at the IMAX with selected scenes in 3D and really enjoyed it. Just overlook the "choppiness" of the flow in the beginning scenes and the fact that hardly anyone seems to realize the similarities w/ Kent/Superman and you'll really enjoy it, too. :)
 
 Kevin Spacey is excellent!
Ooaman

To be completely honest, I wish that it wasn't intended to be with in the story line as the other SuperMan movies (which had the late Christepher Reeves.) I consider this to be a sugestion that it is doomed to be compaired to the other movies. Of course, The Hulk wasn't based off of the TV series of the 70's but everyone was trying to compare it to the series.
 
 
 But did anyone else feel this or was it just me;
 I thought that this new guy was better at playing Clark Kent and Reeves was better at playing Superman.
 
 That's just an opinion but did anyone else feel that?
